thread.title: Victoria demands answers from AEMO for blackout risks during NSW heatwave
thread.title_full: Victoria demands answers from AEMO for blackout risks during NSW heatwave

author: Peter Hannam
title: Victoria demands answers from AEMO for blackout risks during NSW heatwave
text:
Hole in tallest US dam grows Hole in tallest US dam grows 
A nine metre hole has appeared in a section of northern California's Lake Oroville Dam which is expected to worsen. More videos How to stay safe in the heat 
As temperatures rise, so does the risk of dehydration and heat stress. St John Ambulance demonstrates the signs to look out for and how to treat it. 
Lily D'Ambrosio, Victoria's Energy Minister, said the Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) told her that afternoon "they were going to risk interrupting electricity supply in western Victoria (Bendigo and Ballarat) to make sure NSW could keep the lights on". 
"I made it very clear that our government would not tolerate AEMO prioritising NSW over Victorian customers," Ms D'Ambrosio said in a statement on Thursday. Related Content 'Going gangbusters': the new way to beat power costs 
Victoria is also asking for the Turnbull government to address ongoing issues of the electricity grid, 
"How does AEMO operate when there is a crisis? How are these decisions made?" Ms D'Ambrosio said. "Clearly there are significant issues within Australia's energy network." Advertisement 
Fairfax Media understands AEMO's chairman, Tony Marxsen, made the call to the Victorian government, explaining the main transmission line needed to remain at maximum rating, and that to do so might require parts of Victoria to be sacrificed to ensure supply. 
In the end, such blackouts turned out to be unnecessary but the threat remained live until hours after it was made. SHARE
